page.title: 19THE LITTER PICK & WYLAM
page.content: {THE LITTER PICK The litter pick is an annual event in Wylam. It is held in April/May. The parish council gives a pound for everyone involved to the organization of the persons choice. Brownies, scouts, shelter, etc.. raise money in this way. The village is split in to sections for each organization to 'tidy!' and at 12'o'clock, after two hours work, all the groups reassemble to hand in their sacks. Usally over 100 people turn up, mostly children. {WYLAM Wylam is situated mostly on the north bank of the river Tyne approximatley 10.5 miles from Newcastle and about 11 miles from Hexham. It's population is about 2000 and has a very pleasant community spirit amoung the residents and is also a very pleasant place to live.
